name: web_wad_file
tooltip: Your original OoT 1.2 NTSC-U / NTSC-J WAD file (.wad)

name: web_common_key_file
tooltip:
The Wii Common Key is a copyrighted 32 character string needed for WAD encryption.
Google to find it! Do not ask on Discord!

name: web_common_key_string
tooltip:
The Wii Common Key is a copyrighted 32 character string needed for WAD encryption.
Google to find it! Do not ask on Discord!

name: web_wad_channel_id
tooltip:
4 characters, should end with E to ensure Dolphin compatibility.
Note: If you have multiple OoTR WAD files with different Channel IDs installed, the game can crash on a soft reset. Use a Title Deleter to remove old WADs.

name: web_wad_channel_title
tooltip: 20 characters max

name: rom
tooltip: Path to your OoT ROM.

name: output_dir
tooltip: Where to save the result.

name: create_spoiler
tooltip: Enabling this will change the seed.

name: compress_rom
tooltip:
The first time compressed generation will take a while,
but subsequent generations will be quick.
It is highly recommended to compress or the game will crash frequently except on real N64 hardware.
Patch files are used to send the patched data to other
people without sending the ROM file.

name: world_count
tooltip: The amount of generated worlds (>1 for Multiworld)

name: player_num
tooltip: Generate for specific Player.

name: presets
tooltip: Select a setting preset to apply.

name: open_forest
tooltip:
Open Forest: Mido no longer blocks the path to the Deku Tree, and the Kokiri boy no longer blocks the path out of the forest.

Closed Deku: The Kokiri boy no longer blocks the path out of the forest, but Mido still blocks the path to the Deku Tree, requiring Kokiri Sword and Deku Shield to access the Deku Tree.

Closed Forest: The Kokiri Sword and Slingshot are always available somewhere in the forest. This is incompatible with Start as Adult and shuffling 'All Indoors' and/or 'Overworld' entrances will force this to Closed Deku if selected.

name: randomize_settings
tooltip: Randomizes most Main Rules.

name: open_door_of_time
tooltip:
The Door of Time starts opened instead of needing to play the Song of Time.
If this is not set, only an Ocarina and Song of Time must be found to openthe Door of Time.

name: open_fountain
tooltip: King Zora starts out as moved. This also removes Ruto's Letter from the item pool.

name: gerudo_fortress
tooltip:
'Rescue One Carpenter': Only the bottom left carpenter must be rescued.
'Start with Gerudo Card': The carpenters are rescued from the start of the game, and the player starts with the Gerudo Card in the inventory allowing access to Gerudo Training Grounds.

name: bridge
tooltip:
'Always Open': Rainbow Bridge is always present.
'Vanilla Requirements': Spirit/Shadow Medallions and Light Arrows.
'All Spiritual Stones': All 3 Spiritual Stones.
'All Medallions': All 6 Medallions.
'All Dungeons': All Medallions and Spiritual Stones.
'100 Gold Skulltula Tokens': All 100 Gold Skulltula Tokens.

name: logic_rules
tooltip:
Sets the rules the logic uses to determine accessibility.
'Glitchless': No glitches are required, but may require some minor tricks.
'Glitched': Movement oriented glitches are likely required. No locations excluded.
'No Logic': All locations are considered available. May not be beatable.

name: all_reachable
tooltip:
When this option is enabled, the randomizer will guarantee that every item is obtainable and every location is reachable.
When disabled, only required items and locations to beat the game will be guaranteed reachable.
Even when enabled, some locations may still be able to hold the keys needed to reach them.

name: bombchus_in_logic
tooltip:
Bombchus are properly considered in logic. The first Bombchu pack will always be 20.
Subsequent packs will be 5 or 10 based on how many you have.
Bombchus can be purchased for 60/99/180 rupees once they have been found.
Bombchu Bowling opens with Bombchus.
Bombchus are available at Kokiri Shop and the Bazaar. Bombchu refills cannot be bought until Bombchus have been obtained.

name: one_item_per_dungeon
tooltip:
Dungeons have exactly one major item. This naturally makes each dungeon similar in value instead of valued based on chest count.
Spirit Temple Colossus hands count as part of the dungeon.
Spirit Temple has TWO items to match vanilla distribution.
Dungeon items and GS Tokens do not count as major items.

name: trials_random
tooltip: Sets a random number of trials to enter Ganon's Tower.

name: trials
tooltip: Trials are randomly selected. If hints are enabled, then there will be hints for which trials need to be completed.

name: no_escape_sequence
tooltip: The tower escape sequence between Ganondorf and Ganon will be skipped.

name: no_guard_stealth
tooltip: The crawlspace into Hyrule Castle goes straight to Zelda, skipping the guards.

name: no_epona_race
tooltip: Epona can be summoned with Epona's Song without needing to race Ingo.

name: useful_cutscenes
tooltip: The cutscenes of the Poes in Forest Temple, Darunia in Fire Temple, and the introduction to Twinrova will not be skipped.

name: fast_chests
tooltip: All chest animations are fast. If disabled, the animation time is slow for major items.

name: logic_no_night_tokens_without_suns_song
tooltip: GS Tokens that can only be obtained during the night expect you to have Sun's Song to collect them. This prevents needing to wait until night for some locations.

name: free_scarecrow
tooltip: Pulling out the Ocarina near a spot at which Pierre can spawn will do so, without needing the song.

name: start_with_fast_travel
tooltip:
Start the game with Prelude of Light, Serenade of Water, and Farore's Wind.
Two song locations will give items, instead of Prelude and Serenade.

name: start_with_rupees
tooltip: Start the game with 99 rupees.

name: start_with_wallet
tooltip: Start the game with the largest wallet (999 max).

name: start_with_deku_equipment
tooltip:
Start the game with 10 Deku sticks and 20 Deku nuts.
Additionally, start the game with a Deku shield equipped, unless playing with the Shopsanity setting.

name: fast_chickens
tooltip: Moves all except the Chicken near the pen into the pen.

name: big_poe_count_random
tooltip: The Poe buyer will give a reward for turning in a random number of Big Poes.

name: big_poe_count
tooltip: The Poe buyer will give a reward for turning in the chosen number of Big Poes.

name: shuffle_kokiri_sword
tooltip:
Enabling this shuffles the Kokiri Sword into the pool.
This will require extensive use of sticks until the sword is found.

name: shuffle_ocarinas
tooltip:
Enabling this shuffles the Fairy Ocarina and the Ocarina of Time into the pool.
This will require finding an Ocarina before being able to play songs.

name: shuffle_weird_egg
tooltip:
Enabling this shuffles the Weird Egg from Malon into the pool.
This will require finding the Weird Egg to talk to Zelda in Hyrule Castle, which in turn locks rewards from Impa, Saria, Malon, and Talon, as well as the Happy Mask sidequest.
If Open Kakariko Gate is disabled, the Weird Egg will also be required for Zelda's Letter to open the gate as child.

name: shuffle_gerudo_card
tooltip:
Enabling this shuffles the Gerudo Card into the item pool.
The Gerudo Card is required to enter the Gerudo Training Grounds, however it does not prevent the guards throwing you in jail.
This has no effect if the option to Start with Gerudo Card is set.

name: shuffle_song_items
tooltip:
Enabling this shuffles the songs into the rest of the item pool.
This means that song locations can contain other items, and any location can contain a song.
Otherwise, songs are only shuffled among themselves.

name: shuffle_cows
tooltip: Enabling this causes playing Epona's song infront of cows to give an item. There are 9 cows, and an extra in MQ Jabu

name: shuffle_beans
tooltip: Enabling this adds a pack of 10 beans to the item pool and changes the Magic Bean Salesman to sell a random item once at the price of 60 Rupees.

name: entrance_shuffle
tooltip:
Shuffle entrances bidirectionally within different pools.
'Dungeons Only':
Shuffle dungeon entrances with each other, including Bottom of the Well, Ice Cavern, and Gerudo Training Grounds.
However, Ganon's Castle is not shuffled.
Additionally, the entrances of Deku Tree, Fire Temple and Bottom of the Well are opened for both adult and child.

'Simple Indoors':
Shuffle dungeon entrances along with simple Grotto and Interior entrances (i.e. most Houses and Great Fairies).

'All Indoors':
Extended version of 'Simple Indoors' with some extra entrances:
Windmill, Link's House, Temple of Time and Dampe's Grave.

'All Indoors & Overworld':
Same as 'All Indoors' but with Overworld loading zones shuffled in a new separate pool. Owl drop positions are also randomized.

name: shuffle_scrubs
tooltip:
'Off': Only the 3 Scrubs that give one-time items in the vanilla game (PoH, Deku Nut capacity, and Deku Stick capacity) will have random items.
'Affordable': All Scrub prices will be reduced to 10 rupees each.
'Expensive': All Scrub prices will be their vanilla prices. This will require spending over 1000 rupees on Scrubs.
'Random Prices': All Scrub prices will be between 0-99 rupees. This will on average be very, very expensive overall.

name: shopsanity
tooltip:
Shop contents are randomized.
(X Items): Shops have X random non-shop (Special Deal!) items. They will always be on the left side, and some of the lower value shop items will be replaced to make room for these.
(Random): Each shop will have a random number of non-shop items up to a maximum of 4.
The non-shop items have no requirements except money, while the normal shop items (such as 200/300 rupee tunics) have normal vanilla requirements. This means that, for example, as a child you cannot buy 200/300 rupee tunics, but you can buy non-shop tunics.
Non-shop Bombchus will unlock the chu slot in your inventory, which, if Bombchus are in logic, is needed to buy Bombchu refills.
Otherwise, the Bomb Bag is required.

name: tokensanity
tooltip:
Token reward from Gold Skulltulas are shuffled into the pool.
'Dungeons Only': This only shuffles the GS locations that are within dungeons, increasing the value of most dungeons and making internal dungeon exploration more diverse.
'All Tokens': Effectively adds 100 new locations for items to appear.

name: shuffle_mapcompass
tooltip:
'Remove': Maps and Compasses are removed. This will add a small amount of money and refill items to the pool.
'Start With': Maps and Compasses are given to you from the start. This will add a small amount of money and refill items to the pool.
'Vanilla': Maps and Compasses will appear in their vanilla locations.
'Dungeon': Maps and Compasses can only appear in their respective dungeon.
'Anywhere': Maps and Compasses can appear anywhere in the world.
Setting 'Remove', 'Start With', or 'Anywhere' will add 2 more possible locations to each Dungeon.
This makes dungeons more profitable, especially Ice Cavern, Water Temple, and Jabu Jabu's Belly.

name: shuffle_smallkeys
tooltip:
'Remove': Small Keys are removed. All locked doors in dungeons will be unlocked. An easier mode.
'Vanilla': Small Keys will appear in their vanilla locations. You start with 3 keys in Spirit Temple MQ because the vanilla key layout is not beatable in logic.
'Dungeon': Small Keys can only appear in their respective dungeon. If Fire Temple is not a Master Quest dungeon, the door to the Boss Key chest will be unlocked
'Anywhere': Small Keys can appear anywhere in the world. A difficult mode since it is more likely to need to enter a dungeon multiple times.
Try different combinations out, such as:
'Small Keys: Dungeon' + 'Boss Keys: Anywhere' for a milder Keysanity experience.

name: shuffle_bosskeys
tooltip:
'Remove': Boss Keys are removed. All locked doors in dungeons will be unlocked. An easier mode.
'Vanilla': Boss Keys will appear in their vanilla locations.
'Dungeon': Boss Keys can only appear in their respective dungeon.
'Anywhere': Boss Keys can appear anywhere in the world. A difficult mode since it is more likely to need to enter a dungeon multiple times.
Try different combinations out, such as:
'Small Keys: Dungeon' + 'Boss Keys: Anywhere' for a milder Keysanity experience.

name: enhance_map_compass
tooltip:
Gives the Map and Compass extra functionality. Map will tell if a dungeon is vanilla or Master Quest.
Compass will tell what medallion or stone is within. The Temple of Time Altar will no longer provide any information.
'Remove': The dungeon information is not available anywhere in the game.
'Start With': The dungeon information is available immediately from the dungeon menu.

name: unlocked_ganondorf
tooltip: The Boss Key door in Ganon's Tower will start unlocked. This is intended to be used with reduced trial requirements to make it more likely that skipped trials can be avoided.

name: mq_dungeons_random
tooltip: If set, a random number of dungeons will have Master Quest designs.

name: mq_dungeons
tooltip:
Select a number of Master Quest dungeons to appear in the game.
0: All dungeon will have their
original designs. (default)
6: Half of all dungeons will be from Master Quest.
12: All dungeons will have Master Quest redesigns.

name: disabled_locations

options.text: Hyrule Castle Rock Wall Gossip Stone

options.text: Sacred Forest Meadow Maze Gossip Stone (Lower)

options.text: Sacred Forest Meadow Maze Gossip Stone (Upper)

options.name: Sacred Forest Meadow Saria Gossip Stone
options.text: Sacred Forest Meadow Saria Gossip Stone

tooltip:
Prevent locations from being required. Major
items can still appear there, however they
will never be required to beat the game.
Most dungeon locations have a MQ alternative.
If the location does not exist because of MQ
then it will be ignored. So make sure to
disable both versions if that is the intent.

options.name: logic_child_rolling_with_strength
options.text: Rolling Goron (Hot Rodder Goron) as Child with Strength
options.tooltip: Use the bombflower on the stairs or near Medigoron. Timing is tight, especially without backwalking

options.name: logic_fewer_tunic_requirements
options.tooltip:
Allows the following possible without Tunics:
- Enter Water Temple. The key below the center pillar still requires Zora Tunic.
- Enter Fire Temple. Only the first floor is accessible, and not Volvagia.
- Zora's Fountain Bottom Freestanding PoH. Might not have enough health to resurface.
- Gerudo Training Grounds Underwater Silver Rupee Chest. May need to make multiple trips.

options.name: logic_child_deadhand
options.tooltip: Requires 9 sticks or 5 jump slashes.

options.name: logic_man_on_roof
options.tooltip: Can be reached by side-hopping off the watchtower.

options.name: logic_dc_staircase
options.tooltip: The Bow can be used to knock down the stairs with two well-timed shots.

options.name: logic_dc_jump
options.text: Dodongo's Cavern Spike Trap Room Jump without Hover Boots
options.tooltip: Jump is adult only.

options.name: logic_gerudo_kitchen
options.text: Gerudo Fortress "Kitchen" with No Additional Items
options.tooltip: The logic normally guarantees one of Bow, Hookshot, or Hover Boots.

options.name: logic_deku_basement_gs
options.text: Deku Tree Basement Vines GS with Jump Slash
options.tooltip: Can be defeated by doing a precise jump slash.

options.name: logic_rusted_switches
options.tooltip:
Applies to:
- Fire Temple Highest Goron Chest
- MQ Fire Temple Lizalfos Maze
- MQ Spirit Trial

options.name: logic_botw_basement
options.text: Bottom of the Well Basement Chest with Strength & Sticks
options.tooltip: The chest in the basement can be reached with strength by doing a jump slash with a lit stick to access the bomb flowers.

options.name: logic_forest_mq_block_puzzle
options.text: Skip Forest Temple MQ Block Puzzle with Bombchu
options.tooltip: Send the Bombchu straight up the center of the wall directly to the left upon entering the room.

options.name: logic_spirit_child_bombchu
options.text: Spirit Temple Child Side Bridge with Bombchu
options.tooltip: A carefully-timed Bombchu can hit the switch.

options.name: logic_windmill_poh
options.text: Windmill PoH as Adult with Nothing
options.tooltip: Can jump up to the spinning platform from below as adult.

options.name: logic_crater_bean_poh_with_hovers
options.text: Crater's Bean PoH with Hover Boots
options.tooltip: Hover from the base of the bridge near Goron City and walk up the very steep slope.

options.name: logic_zora_with_cucco
options.tooltip: Can fly behind the waterfall with a cucco as child.

options.name: logic_gtg_mq_with_hookshot
options.text: Gerudo Training Grounds MQ Left Side Silver Rupees with Hookshot
options.tooltip: The highest silver rupee can be obtained by hookshotting the target and then immediately jump slashing toward the rupee.

options.name: logic_forest_vines
options.text: Forest Temple East Courtyard Vines with Hookshot
options.tooltip: The vines in Forest Temple leading to where the well drain switch is in the standard form can be barely reached with just the Hookshot.

options.name: logic_forest_well_swim
options.text: Swim Through Forest Temple MQ Well with Hookshot
options.tooltip: Shoot the vines in the well as low and as far to the right as possible, and then immediately swim under the ceiling to the right. This can only be required if Forest Temple is in its Master Quest form.

options.name: logic_dmt_bombable
options.text: Death Mountain Trail Bombable Chest with Strength
options.tooltip: Child Link can blow up the wall using a nearby bomb flower. You must backwalk with the flower and then quickly throw it toward the wall.

options.name: logic_water_bk_chest
options.text: Water Temple Boss Key Chest with No Additional Items
options.tooltip:
After reaching the Boss Key chest's area with Iron Boots and Longshot, the chest can be reached with no additional items aside from Small Keys.
Stand on the blue switch with the Iron Boots, wait for the water to rise all the way up, and then swim straight to the exit. You should grab the ledge as you surface.
It works best if you don't mash B.

options.name: logic_adult_kokiri_gs
options.text: Adult Kokiri Forest GS with Hover Boots
options.tooltip: Can be obtained without Hookshot by using the Hover Boots off of one of the roots.

options.name: logic_spirit_mq_frozen_eye
options.text: Spirit Temple MQ Frozen Eye Switch without Fire
options.tooltip: You can melt the ice by shooting an arrow through a torch. The only way to find a line of sight for thisshot is to first spawn a Song of Time block, and then stand on the very edge of it.

options.name: logic_spirit_wall
options.text: Spirit Temple Shifting Wall with No Additional Items
options.tooltip: The logic normally guarantees a way of dealing with both the Beamos and the Walltula before climbing the wall.

options.name: logic_spirit_lobby_gs
options.text: Spirit Temple Main Room GS with Boomerang
options.tooltip:
Standing on the highest part of the arm of the statue, a precise Boomerang throw can kill and obtain this Gold Skulltula.
You must throw the Boomerang slightly off to the side so that it curves into the Skulltula, as aiming directly at it will clank off of the wall in front.

options.name: logic_spirit_mq_sun_block_gs
options.text: Spirit Temple MQ Sun Block Room GS with Boomerang
options.tooltip: Throw the Boomerang in such a way that it curves through the side of the glass block to hit the Gold Skulltula.

options.name: logic_jabu_mq_sot_gs
options.text: Jabu MQ Song of Time Block GS with Boomerang
options.tooltip: Allow the Boomerang to return to you through the Song of Time block to grab the token.

options.name: logic_botw_mq_dead_hand_key
options.text: Bottom of the Well MQ Dead Hand Freestanding Key with Boomerang
options.tooltip: Boomerang can fish the item out of the rubble without needing explosives to blow it up.

options.name: logic_fire_flame_maze
options.text: Fire Temple Flame Wall Maze Skip
options.tooltip:
If you move quickly you can sneak past the edge of a flame wall before it can rise up to block you. To do it without taking damage is more precise.
Allows you to progress without needing either a Small Key or Hover Boots.

options.name: logic_fire_mq_flame_maze
options.text: Fire Temple MQ Flame Wall Maze Skip
options.tooltip:
If you move quickly you can sneak past the edge of a flame wall before it can rise up to block you. To do it without taking damage is more precise.
Allows you to reach a GS without needing either Song of Time or Hover Boots.

options.name: logic_fire_mq_near_boss
options.text: Fire Temple MQ Chest Near Boss without Breaking Crate
options.tooltip: The hitbox for the torch extends a bit outside of the crate. Shoot a flaming arrow at the side of the crate to light the torch without needing to get over there and break the crate.

options.name: logic_fire_mq_maze_side_room
options.text: Fire Temple MQ Boulder Maze Side Room without Box
options.tooltip: You can walk from the blue switch to the door and quickly open the door before the bars reclose. This skips needing the Hookshot in order to reach a box to place on the switch.

options.name: logic_fire_mq_bk_chest
options.text: Fire Temple MQ Boss Key Chest without Bow
options.tooltip: Din's alone can be used to unbar the door to the boss key chest's room thanks to an oversight in the way the game counts how many torches have been lit.

options.name: logic_zora_river_lower
options.text: Zora's River Lower Freestanding PoH as Adult with Nothing
options.tooltip: Adult can reach this PoH with a precise jump, no Hover Boots required.

options.name: logic_water_cracked_wall_hovers
options.text: Water Temple Cracked Wall with Hover Boots
options.tooltip: With a midair side-hop while wearing the Hover Boots, you can reach the cracked wall without needing to raise the water up to the middle level.

options.name: logic_shadow_freestanding_key
options.text: Shadow Temple Freestanding Key with Bombchu
options.tooltip: Release the Bombchu with good timing so that it explodes near the bottom of the pot.

options.name: logic_adult_meadow_access
options.text: Adult Meadow Access without Saria's or Minuet
options.tooltip: With a specific position and angle, you can backflip over Mido.

options.name: logic_volvagia_jump
options.text: Reach Volvagia without Hover Boots or Pillar
options.tooltip:
The Fire Temple Boss Door can be reached with a precise jump.
You must be touching the side wall of the room so that Link will grab the ledge from farther away than is normally possible.

options.name: logic_lab_diving
options.text: Diving in the Lab without Gold Scale
options.tooltip: Remove the Iron Boots in the midst of Hookshotting the underwater crate.

options.name: logic_biggoron_bolero
options.text: Deliver Eye Drops with Bolero of Fire
options.tooltip:
If you do not wear the Goron Tunic, the heat timer inside the crater will override the trade item's timer.
When you exit to Death Mountain Trail you will have one second to deliver the Eye Drops before the timer expires.
It works best if you play Bolero as quickly as possible upon receiving the Eye Drops.
If you have few hearts, there is enough time to dip Goron City to refresh the heat timer as long as you've already pulled the block.

options.name: logic_wasteland_crossing
options.text: Wasteland Crossing without Hover Boots or Longshot
options.tooltip: You can beat the quicksand by backwalking across it in a specific way.

options.name: logic_colossus_gs
options.text: Desert Colossus Hill GS with Hookshot
options.tooltip: Somewhat precise. If you kill enough Leevers you can get enough of a break to take some time to aim more carefully.

options.name: logic_dc_scarecrow_gs
options.text: Dodongo's Cavern Scarecrow GS with Armos Statue
options.tooltip:
You can jump off an Armos Statue to reach the alcove with the Gold Skulltula. It takes quite a long time to pull the statue the entire way.
The jump to the alcove can be a pit picky when done as child.

options.name: logic_kakariko_tower_gs
options.text: Kakariko Tower GS with Jump Slash
options.tooltip: Climb the tower as high as you can without touching the Gold Skulltula, then let go and jump slash immediately. You will take fall damage.

options.name: logic_lab_wall_gs
options.text: Lake Hylia Lab Wall GS with Jump Slash
options.tooltip: The jump slash to actually collect the token is somewhat precise.

options.name: logic_spirit_mq_lower_adult'
options.text: Spirit Temple MQ Lower Adult without Fire Arrows
options.tooltip:
It can be done with Din's Fire and Bow. Whenever an arrow passes through a lit torch, it resets the timer.
It's finicky but it's also possible to stand on the pillar next to the center torch, which makes it easier.

options.name: logic_spirit_map_chest
options.text: Spirit Temple Map Chest with Bow
options.tooltip: To get a line of sight from the upper torch to the map chest torches, you must pull an Armos statue all the way up the stairs.

options.name: logic_spirit_sun_chest
options.text: Spirit Temple Sun Block Room Chest with Bow
options.tooltip:
Using the blocks in the room as platforms you can get lines of sight to all three torches.
The timer on the torches is quite short so you must move quickly in order to light all three.

options.name: logic_forest_outdoors_ledge
options.text: Forest Temple NE Outdoors Ledge with Hover Boots
options.tooltip:
With precise Hover Boots movement you can fall down to this ledge from upper balconies.
If done precisely enough, it is not necessary to take fall damage.
In MQ, this skips a Longshot requirement.
In Vanilla, this can skip a Hookshot requirement in entrance randomizer.

options.name: logic_water_boss_key_region
options.text: Water Temple Boss Key Region with Hover Boots
options.tooltip:
With precise Hover Boots movement it is possible to reach the boss key chest's region without needing the Longshot.
It is not necessary to take damage from the spikes.
The Gold Skulltula Token in the following room can also be obtained with just the Hover Boots.

options.name: logic_water_falling_platform_gs
options.text: Water Temple Falling Platform Room GS with Hookshot
options.tooltip: If you stand on the very edge of the platform, this Gold Skulltula can be obtained with only the Hookshot.

options.name: logic_crater_upper_to_lower
options.text: Death Mountain Crater Upper to Lower with Hammer
options.tooltip: With the Hammer, you can jumpslash the rock twice in the same jump in order to destroy it before you fall into the lava.

options.name: logic_zora_with_hovers
options.text: Zora's Domain Entry with Hover Boots
options.tooltip: Can hover behind the waterfall as adult.

options.name: logic_shadow_statue
options.text: Shadow Temple River Statue with Bombchu
options.tooltip: By sending a Bombchu around the edge of the gorge, you can knock down the statue without needing a Bow. Applies in both vanilla and MQ Shadow.

options.name: logic_link_goron_dins
options.text: Stop Link the Goron with Din's Fire
options.tooltip: The timing is quite awkward.

options.name: logic_fire_song_of_time
options.text: Fire Temple Song of Time Room GS without Song of Time
options.tooltip: A precise jump can be used to reach this room.

options.name: logic_fire_strength
options.tooltip: A precise jump can be used to skip pushing the block.

options.name: logic_fire_mq_bombable_chest
options.text: Fire Temple MQ Big Lava Room Bombable Chest without Hookshot
options.tooltip:
A precisely-angled jump can get over the wall of fire in this room.
It's expected that you will take damage as you do this. As it may take multiple attempts, you won't be expected to use a fairy to survive.

options.name: logic_light_trial_mq
options.tooltip:
If you move quickly you can sneak past the edge of a flame wall before it can rise up to block you.
In this case it doesn't seem possible to do it without taking damage.

options.name: logic_ice_mq_scarecrow
options.text: Ice Cavern MQ Scarecrow GS with No Additional Items
options.tooltip: A precise jump can be used to reach this alcove.

options.name: logic_visible_collisions
options.tooltip:
Allows climbing through the platform to reach Impa's House Back as adult with no items and
going through the Kakariko Village Gate as child when coming from the Mountain Trail side.

name: logic_earliest_adult_trade
tooltip: Select the earliest item that can appear in the adult trade sequence.

name: logic_latest_adult_trade
tooltip: Select the latest item that can appear in the adult trade sequence.

name: logic_lens
tooltip:
'Required everywhere': every invisible or fake object will expect you to have the Lens of Truth and Magic. The exception is passing through the first wall in Bottom of the Well, since that is required in vanilla.
'Wasteland': The lens is needed to follow the ghost guide across the Haunted Wasteland.

name: ocarina_songs
tooltip:
Will need to memorize a new set of songs. Can be silly, but difficult.
Songs are generally sensible, and warp songs are typically more difficult.

name: correct_chest_sizes
tooltip:
Chests will be large if they contain a major item and small if they don't. Boss keys will be in gold chests. This allows skippingchests if they are small.
However, skipping small chests will mean having low health, ammo, and rupees, so doing so is a risk.

name: clearer_hints
tooltip: The hints provided by Gossip Stones will be very direct if this option is enabled.

name: hints
tooltip:
Gossip Stones can be made to give hints about where items can be found.
Different settings can be chosen to decide which item is needed to speak to Gossip Stones.
Choosing to stick with the Mask of Truth will make the hints very difficult to obtain.
Hints for 'on the way of the hero' are locations that contain items that are required to beat the game.

name: hint_dist
tooltip:
Useless has nothing but junk hints.
Strong distribution has some duplicate hints and no junk hints.
Very Strong distribution has only very useful hints.
Tournament distribution is similar to Strong but with no variation in hint types.

name: text_shuffle
tooltip:
Will make things confusing for comedic value.
'Shuffled except Hints and Keys': Key texts are not shuffled because in keysanity it is inconvenient to figure out which keys are which without the correct text.
Similarly, non-shop items sold in shops will also retain standard text for the purpose of accurate price checks.

name: junk_ice_traps
tooltip:
Off: All Ice Traps are removed.
Normal: Only Ice Traps from the base item pool are placed.
Extra Ice Traps: Chance to add extra Ice Traps when junk items are added to the itempool.
Ice Trap Mayhem: All added junk items will be Ice Traps.
Ice Trap Onslaught: All junk items will be replaced by Ice Traps, even those in the base pool.

name: item_pool_value
tooltip:
Changes the amount of bonus items that are available in the game.
'Plentiful': Extra major items are added.
'Balanced': Original item pool.
'Scarce': Some excess items are removed, including health upgrades.
'Minimal': Most excess items are removed.

name: damage_multiplier
tooltip:
Changes the amount of damage taken.
'OHKO': Link dies in one hit.

name: starting_tod
tooltip:
Change up Link's sleep routine.
Daytime officially starts at 6:30, nighttime at 18:00 (6:00 PM).
Default is 10:00 in the morning.
The alternatives are multiples of 3 hours.

name: starting_age
tooltip:
Choose which age Link will start as.
Starting as adult means you start with the master sword in your inventory.

name: background_music
tooltip:
'No Music': No background music is played.
'Random': Area background music is randomized.

name: display_dpad
tooltip: Shows an additional HUD element displaying current available options on the D-Pad.

name: kokiri_color
tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random color from any color the N64 can draw.

name: goron_color
tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random color from any color the N64 can draw.

name: zora_color
tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random color from any color the N64 can draw.

name: navi_color_default
tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random color from any color the N64 can draw.

name: navi_color_enemy
tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random color from any color the N64 can draw.

name: navi_color_npc
tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random color from any color the N64 can draw.

name: navi_color_prop
tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random color from any color the N64 can draw.

name: sword_trail_duration
tooltip: Select the duration for sword trails.

name: sword_trail_color_inner
tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random color from any color the N64 can draw.
'Rainbow': Rainbow sword trails.

name: sword_trail_color_outer
tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random color from any color the N64 can draw. 'Rainbow': Rainbow sword trails.

name: heart_color
tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random color from any color the N64 can draw.

name: magic_color
tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random color from any color the N64 can draw.

name: silver_gauntlets_color
tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random color from any color the N64 can draw.

name: golden_gauntlets_color
tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random color from any color the N64 can draw.

name: sfx_low_hp
tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random sound from this list.
'Default': Beep. Beep. Beep.

name: sfx_navi_overworld
tooltip: 'Random Choice': Choose a random sound from this list.

name: sfx_navi_enemy
tooltip: 'Random Choice': Choose a random sound from this list.

name: sfx_menu_cursor
tooltip: 'Random Choice': Choose a random sound from this list.

name: sfx_menu_select
tooltip: 'Random Choice': Choose a random sound from this list.

name: sfx_horse_neigh
tooltip: 'Random Choice': Choose a random sound from this list. 'Default': Neigh. Neigh. Neigh.

name: sfx_nightfall
tooltip: 'Random Choice': Choose a random sound from this list. 'Default': Wolf Howl

name: sfx_hover_boots
tooltip: 'Random Choice': Choose a random sound from this list.

name: sfx_ocarina
tooltip: Change the sound of the ocarina.
